pages.title: First, tell us a little about yourself
pages.header: This survey takes approximately 5 minutes to complete.

fields.label: How long have you worked at this organization (in years)?
fields.name: org_years

fields.label: What team and/or department do you work in?
fields.name: team

fields.label: How many layers of management are you below {{orgLeader}}?
fields.help: If you're not sure, take your best guess.
fields.name: management_layers

fields.label: We are growing faster than our competitors.
fields.name: org_traction

fields.label: We are more profitable than our competitors.
fields.name: org_profitability

fields.label: Rate your level of agreement with the following statements.

peop1.positive: Q1: We tend to measure our success (or failures) in non-financial terms
peop1.negative: Q1: We tend to measure our success (or failure) primarily in financial terms

peop2.positive: Q2: I believe in what my organization is fundamentally about. I'd rather invest my time and energy in this company than start over somewhere else
peop2.negative: Q2: If I were offered a job with a higher salary at another company I wouldn't hesitate to take it.

peop3.positive: Q3: I am surrounded by amazing talent – partners and colleagues – and we’re all here to pursue our organization’s purpose
peop3.negative: Q3: I'm not particularly impressed by my colleagues's talent or their commitment to our cause

peop4.positive: Q4: I know exactly how my goals or objectives connect to our organization’s purpose
peop4.negative: Q4: I am not exactly sure how my daily work contributes to the organization's overarching objectives or purpose

peop5.positive: Q5: In the absence of a clear directive, I use our organization’s purpose to make tough decisions and do the right thing
peop5.negative: Q5: In the absence of a clear directive I find it challenging to improvise, because I don't have an understanding of the bigger picture

fields.label: For the statements you disagreed with (either somewhat or strongly), what can the organization do to improve?
fields.name: peop_verbatims

fields.label: Rate your level of agreement with the following statements.

eeoc1.positive: Q1: My customers' satisfaction is more important than meeting my superiors' expectations
eeoc1.negative: Q1: Meeting my superiors' expectations is more important than my customers' satisfaction

eeoc2.positive: Q2: I have a budget, and I’m free to spend it the way I see fit
eeoc2.negative: Q2: I don't have a budget; or, I have a budget but I'm not free to spend it the way I see fit

eeoc3.positive: Q3: I have the power to abandon work I know isn't generating any value
eeoc3.negative: Q3: I am pursuing work I know isn't generating any value

eeoc4.positive: Q4: I'm able to decide which tools, software, and methods I use to get my work done
eeoc4.negative: Q4: The tools, software, and methods I use to get my work done are dictated to me by the organization and I don't have the authority to deviate

eeoc5.positive: Q5: When it's not clear who has the authority to make a decision, I feel comfortable making that decision rather than delaying
eeoc5.negative: Q5: I don't feel safe making decisions unless I am certain I have the authority

fields.label: For the statements you disagreed with (either somewhat or strongly), what can the organization do to improve?
fields.name: eeoc_verbatims

fields.label: Rate your level of agreement with the following statements.

eeop1.positive: Q1: I rarely have a "big reveal" for my work products – instead I make many incremental improvements
eeop1.negative: Q1: I prefer to bundle my improvements into a "big reveal" rather than publish small updates to my work product

eeop2.positive: Q2: I've been part of a team working on an experimental product or project without a long-term roadmap
eeop2.negative: Q2: I've never been part of a team working on an experimental product or project without a long-term roadmap

eeop3.positive: Q3: I have the ability to change my team's structure (size, disciplines, objectives) with their consent
eeop3.negative: Q3: Even if my team were supportive, I wouldn't make changes to my team (size, disciplines, objectives) unless directed to by my superior

eeop4.positive: Q4: It's easy to release products and render services to those I serve
eeop4.negative: Q4: Launching a new initiative is more difficult than it needs to be

eeop5.positive: Q5: I can easily access my teammate's work and help them improve it, without having to ask
eeop5.negative: Q5: It's difficult for me to access my teammate's work to improve upon it unless they send it to me as an e-mail attachment

fields.label: For the statements you disagreed with (either somewhat or strongly), what can the organization do to improve?
fields.name: eeop_verbatims

fields.label: Rate your level of agreement with the following statements.

neoh1.positive: Q1: I have frequent contact with my customers
neoh1.negative: Q1: I rarely have direct contact with our customers

neoh2.positive: Q2: I actively solicit feedback on my team's work products, and use this feedback to improve
neoh2.negative: Q2: It is difficult for me to solicit and use feedback to improve our work products

neoh3.positive: Q3: The people that review my performance are the ones that work closely with me
neoh3.negative: Q3: I don't work closely with the individuals who review my performance

neoh4.positive: Q4: I can access feedback or metrics on our products without having to ask for it
neoh4.negative: Q4: We don't know if there is a problem with one of our products or services until someone calls or emails us

neoh5.positive: Q5: I can easily ask people outside my team (even customers) for feedback on work when it's at an early stage
neoh5.negative: Q5: It's challenging to get feedback from people outside my team – including customers – on work at an early stage

fields.label: For the statements you disagreed with (either somewhat or strongly), what can the organization do to improve?
fields.name: neoh_verbatims

fields.label: Rate your level of agreement with the following statements.

aeoe1.positive: Q1: I am allowed to assume new responsibilities (even if they overlap with someone else), if it brings us closer to realizing our goal
aeoe1.negative: Q1: I am not allowed to choose to take on new responsibilities, even if doing so would bring us closer to realizing our goal

aeoe2.positive: Q2: My role is creative and I produce output directly, rather than rely on outside vendors
aeoe2.negative: Q2: I tend to rely on outside vendors when it comes to actual creative output

aeoe3.positive: Q3: I'm rarely asked to speculate on the potential impact of my work – instead, I share results from customer-facing tests
aeoe3.negative: Q3: My boss understands that it's not always necessary to consult customers when making changes to a product or service

aeoe4.positive: Q4: If an initiative falters, I'm expected to be honest about our missteps rather than only focus on what went well
aeoe4.negative: Q4: If an initiative falters, I'm expected to focus on what went well instead of sharing our missteps

aeoe5.positive: Q5: I post my successes and failures in a central location my team can access so my team can benefit from what I learn
aeoe5.negative: Q5: As an organization we tend to erase failed initiatives from our collective memory

fields.label: For the statements you disagreed with (either somewhat or strongly), what can the organization do to improve?
fields.name: aeoe_verbatims

fields.label: Rate your level of agreement with the following statements.

teop1.positive: Q1: I keep a to-do list that is open to anyone who wants to see it
teop1.negative: Q1: I don't share my to-do list with anyone

teop2.positive: Q2: I am inclined to share my team's work and ultimate findings with anyone in the company who wants to know, I classify information only when necessary
teop2.negative: Q2: I prefer to share information on a strictly "need to know" basis

teop3.positive: Q3: I can easily get the information I need to do my job well
teop3.negative: Q3: I have difficulty getting the information I need to do my job well

teop4.positive: Q4: Other teams in the organization know exactly how to work with out team, what we provide, and how to request our services
teop4.negative: Q4: I frequently must correct other team's expectations of the sort of work my team and I perform

teop5.positive: Q5: I frequently share drafts of my work, before it's been packaged for a wider audience
teop5.negative: Q5: I rarely share drafts of my work before it's been packaged for a wider audience

fields.label: For the statements you disagreed with (either somewhat or strongly), what can the organization do to improve?
fields.name: teop_verbatims
